instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 green light OK, fan spins at high speed, no chime
threads.message:
Hello,

I managed to repair the onewire circuit on this board myself :) Now, when I plug in the charger I get a green light after about 5 seconds and the fan immediately starts spinning and goes full speed after some more seconds. No chime. I short the pads next to the keyboard connector and the board shuts off. If I then short the pads again, it does not boot...

Any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 green light OK, fan spins at high speed, no chime
threads.message: Vcore present on L7100? Resistance to GND on 3V42 bus?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 green light OK, fan spins at high speed, no chime
threads.message: No L7100. On L7400 it shows 0.991. Resistance to GND on 3V42 bus is .093

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 green light OK, fan spins at high speed, no chime
[SOLVED]820-2879 green light OK, fan spins at high speed, no chime
threads.message: OK thank you Duke for putting this board out of its misery... on to the next one on the pile!
